title: [Large-Scale] Investigating Basic Chemistry Concepts: Understanding Elements, Compounds, and Mixtures

context.additional_context: A self-directed inquiry learning environment using smartphone-based webquests

learning_goals: Learners can explain the definitions and differences between elements, compounds, and mixtures using scientific terminology
Learners can classify everyday substances as elements/compounds/mixtures and provide scientific justifications
Learners can observe differences in materials at the molecular level and represent them visually through VR simulations.

Learners complete 2 webquest tasks during a 3-week mid-term course, write a 1,000-character analysis report on real IT cases (e.g., web application development), and achieve a 'B' (70+ points) grade in 4 out of 5 peer assessment rubric items.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
